verses.roman:
evaṁ matsariṇam hatvā
pauṇḍrakaṁ sa-sakhaṁ hariḥ
dvārakām āviśat siddhair
gīyamāna-kathāmṛtaḥ

synonyms: evam—thus; matsariṇam—envious; hatvā—killing; pauṇḍrakam—Pauṇḍraka; sa—together with; sakham—his friend; hariḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; dvārakām—Dvārakā; āviśat—He entered; siddhaiḥ—by the mystics of heaven; gīyamāna—being sung; kathā—narrations about Him; amṛtaḥ—nectarean.
translation: Having thus killed envious Pauṇḍraka and his ally, Lord Kṛṣṇa returned to Dvārakā. As He entered the city, the Siddhas of heaven chanted His immortal, nectarean glories.
